N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 3050.12 - Fees and costs

State Regulations
(a) Preparing
EIS's for proposed actions involving applicants. The authority shall prepare or
cause to be prepared an EIS for a proposed action involving an applicant only
where practicable considering existing staff and resources and when the public
interest will be thereby served. In such cases, the authority may charge a fee
and costs to the applicant for the preparation of such EIS. Where the authority
reviews an EIS for a proposed action involving an applicant, the authority may
charge a fee and costs to the applicant for the review of an EIS involved with
said action. The fee and costs charged shall be the entire costs to the
authority of such preparation and/or review. The fee and costs shall include
personal services of authority employees computed at an hourly rate, fringe
benefits attributable to such personal services, overhead attributable to such
personal services plus any other costs attributable to EIS preparation or
review. In no event shall the fee for EIS preparation and review exceed any
limit contained in 6 NYCRR
617.11. (b) Fees to cover miscellaneous costs. The
authority may also charge a fee to an applicant for the costs of publishing or
filing any notices required by this Part and for costs incurred in the conduct
of a public hearing. The fee charged shall be the entire cost to the authority
of such publishing, filing or hearings. The costs shall include personal
services of authority employees; computed as set forth in subdivision (a) of
this section. (c) The technical
services of the authority may be made available on a fee basis reflecting the
costs thereof to other agencies, and the fee charged to any applicant pursuant
to this section may reflect such costs. Notes
